p: When genetic mutations were assessed, it was found that 8 (15.7%) patients had no mutation, while 29 (56.9%) patients were heterozygous carrier and 14 (27.5%) patients were homozygous mutant in the patient group. It was found that 19 (37.3%) patients were normal, while 19 (37.3%) patients were heterozygous carrier and 13 (25.5%) patients were homozygous mutant in the control group ( Table 1). These findings indicate significant differences between patient and control groups. The VKOR1-1639>A mutant positivity (homozygous plus heterozygous mutant) was significantly higher in the patient group compared to controls ( P = .037). There was significant difference between patient and control groups regarding no mutation and heterozygous mutation ( P < .05) but not homozygous mutation ( P < .05).
